response:
Urgent investigations are needed to confirm or exclude giant cell arteritis, distinguish optic nerve from primary retinal pathology, identify demyelinating or compressive causes, and document the extent of visual pathway damage while also assessing vascular risk factors and suitability for prolonged corticosteroid therapy.

investigations = ["Urgent ophthalmology assessment with dilated fundus examination", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "C-reactive protein", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "Blood glucose", "Temporal artery ultrasound", "Temporal artery biopsy", "MRI of orbits and brain with gadolinium contrast", "Visual field testing with automated perimetry", "Optical coherence tomography of retinal nerve fiber layer and macula", "Lipid profile", "Autoimmune screen including antinuclear antibodies and extractable nuclear antigen panel", "Antineutrophil cytoplasmic antibodies", "Serum angiotensin converting enzyme level", "Infectious screen including syphilis serology and Lyme serology if clinically indicated"]
